title.en: Chronicle of Feudal Lords since the Han Founding

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：殷以前尚矣。

translations.literal: Sima Qian said: The Yin and earlier are still distant.
translations.idiomatic: Sima Qian said: The Yin and earlier periods are still remote.

sentences.zh: 周封五等：公，侯，伯，子，男。

translations.literal: Zhou enfeoffed five ranks: duke, marquis, earl, viscount, baron.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou enfeoffed five ranks of nobility: dukes, marquises, earls, viscounts, and barons.

sentences.zh: 然封伯禽、康叔於魯、衛，地各四百里，親親之義，褒有德也；

translations.literal: Yet they enfeoffed Bo Qin and Kang Shu at Lu and Wei, each with four hundred li of land, showing the righteousness of loving relatives, praising those with virtue;
translations.idiomatic: Yet they enfeoffed Bo Qin and Kang Shu at Lu and Wei, each with four hundred li of territory, demonstrating the principle of favoring relatives and rewarding those with virtue;

sentences.zh: 太公於齊，兼五侯地，尊勤勞也。

translations.literal: Tai Gong at Qi, combined five marquises' land, honoring diligent labor.
translations.idiomatic: Tai Gong at Qi was given land combining five marquises' territories, honoring his diligent service.

sentences.zh: 武王、成、康所封數百，而同姓五十五，地上不過百里，下三十里，以輔衛王室。

translations.literal: King Wu, Cheng, and Kang enfeoffed several hundred, and paternal clans fifty-five, land above not exceeding one hundred li, below thirty li, to assist and protect the royal house.
translations.idiomatic: Kings Wu, Cheng, and Kang enfeoffed several hundred nobles, with fifty-five being paternal relatives, their territories ranging from no more than one hundred li down to thirty li, to support and protect the royal house.

sentences.zh: 管、蔡、康叔、曹、鄭，或過或損。

translations.literal: Guan, Cai, Kang Shu, Cao, Zheng, some exceeded some diminished.
translations.idiomatic: Guan, Cai, Kang Shu, Cao, and Zheng - some were given more territory, others less.

sentences.zh: 厲、幽之後，王室缺，侯伯彊國興焉，天子微，弗能正。

translations.literal: Li, You after, royal house deficient, hou bo strong states rose, Son of Heaven weak, could not correct.
translations.idiomatic: After the reigns of Kings Li and You, the royal house declined, and powerful states ruled by marquises and earls arose. The Son of Heaven grew weak and could no longer control them.

sentences.zh: 非德不純，形勢弱也。

translations.literal: Not virtue not pure, form situation weak also.
translations.idiomatic: It was not that their virtue was impure, but that their position was weak.

translations.literal: Sima Qian said: The Yin and earlier periods are still remote. The Zhou enfeoffed five ranks of nobility: dukes, marquises, earls, viscounts, and barons. Yet they enfeoffed Bo Qin and Kang Shu at Lu and Wei, each with four hundred li of territory, demonstrating the principle of favoring relatives and rewarding those with virtue; Tai Gong at Qi was given land combining five marquises' territories, honoring his diligent service. Kings Wu, Cheng, and Kang enfeoffed several hundred nobles, with fifty-five being paternal relatives, their territories ranging from no more than one hundred li down to thirty li, to support and protect the royal house. Guan, Cai, Kang Shu, Cao, and Zheng - some were given more territory, others less. After the reigns of Kings Li and You, the royal house declined, and powerful states ruled by marquises and earls arose. The Son of Heaven grew weak and could no longer control them. It was not that their virtue was impure, but that their position was weak.

sentences.zh: 漢興，序二等。

translations.literal: Han rose, ordered two ranks.
translations.idiomatic: When the Han arose, they established two ranks of nobility.

sentences.zh: 高祖末年，非劉氏而王者，若無功上所不置而侯者，天下共誅之。

translations.literal: Gaozu late years, not Liu clan wang, if no merit shang not established hou, world together executed them.
translations.idiomatic: In the later years of Gaozu's reign, anyone not of the Liu clan who became king, or who became a marquis without merit and without imperial approval, would be executed by all under heaven.

sentences.zh: 高祖子弟同姓為王者九國，雖獨長沙異姓，而功臣侯者百有餘人。

translations.literal: Gaozu sons younger brothers same surname wang nine states, though only Changsha different surname, merit minister hou hundred plus people.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu's sons and younger brothers of the same surname who became kings numbered nine states, and though only Changsha was of a different surname, there were more than a hundred meritorious ministers who became marquises.

sentences.zh: 自雁門、太原以東至遼陽，為燕代國；

translations.literal: From Yan Men, Tai Yuan east to Liao Yang, for Yan Dai states;
translations.idiomatic: From Yanmen and Taiyuan eastward to Liaoyang became the Yan and Dai states;

sentences.zh: 常山以南，大行左轉，度河、濟，阿、甄以東薄海，為齊、趙國；

translations.literal: Chang Shan south, Tai Xing left turn, cross river, Ji, E, Zhen east thin sea, for Qi, Zhao states;
translations.idiomatic: South of Mount Chang, where the Great Wall turns left, crossing the Yellow River and Ji Rivers, from E and Zhen eastward to the sea became the Qi and Zhao states;

sentences.zh: 自陳以西，南至九疑，東帶江、淮、谷、泗，薄會稽，為梁、楚、淮南、長沙國：皆外接於胡、越。

translations.literal: From Chen west, south to Jiu Yi, east belt Jiang, Huai, Gu, Si, thin Kui Ji, for Liang, Chu, Huai Nan, Changsha states: all outer connect Hu, Yue.
translations.idiomatic: From Chen westward, south to the Nine Doubts Mountains, east along the Jiang, Huai, Gu, and Si Rivers, bordering Kuaiji, became the Liang, Chu, Huainan, and Changsha states: all bordering externally on the Hu and Yue barbarians.

sentences.zh: 而內地北距山以東盡諸侯地，大者或五六郡，連城數十，置百官宮觀，僭於天子。

translations.literal: And inner lands north face mountains east exhaust feudal lords lands, great ones or five six jun, connected cities several ten, established hundred officials palaces observatories, usurped Son of Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: As for the inner lands north of the mountains eastward, all were the territories of feudal lords. The largest domains encompassed five or six commanderies, with dozens of connected cities. They established hundreds of officials and built palaces and observatories that rivaled the Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 漢獨有三河、東郡、潁川、南陽，自江陵以西至蜀，北自雲中至隴西，與內史凡十五郡，而公主列侯頗食邑其中。

translations.literal: Han alone had San He, Dong Jun, Ying Chuan, Nan Yang, from Jiang Ling west to Shu, north from Yun Zhong to Long Xi, with Nei Shi altogether fifteen jun, and princesses lie hou much eat yi among them.
translations.idiomatic: The Han alone controlled Sanhe, Dongjun, Yingchuan, and Nanyang commanderies, stretching from Jiangling westward to Shu and northward from Yunzhong to Longxi. Together with the capital region, this made fifteen commanderies in total. Many princesses and marquises also held fiefs within these territories.

sentences.zh: 何者？

translations.literal: Why?
translations.idiomatic: Why was this so?

sentences.zh: 天下初定，骨肉同姓少，故廣彊庶孽，以鎮撫四海，用承衛天子也。

translations.literal: World initially settled, bone flesh same surname few, therefore broad strong collateral descendants, to pacify four seas, use support protect Son of Heaven also.
translations.idiomatic: When the realm was first pacified, there were few close relatives of the same surname, so the emperor strengthened collateral branches of the family to maintain control over the four seas and support the Son of Heaven.

translations.literal: When the Han arose, they established two ranks of nobility. In the later years of Gaozu's reign, anyone not of the Liu clan who became king, or who became a marquis without merit and without imperial approval, would be executed by all under heaven. Gaozu's sons and younger brothers of the same surname who became kings numbered nine states, and though only Changsha was of a different surname, there were more than a hundred meritorious ministers who became marquises. From Yanmen and Taiyuan eastward to Liaoyang became the Yan and Dai states; South of Mount Chang, where the Great Wall turns left, crossing the Yellow River and Ji Rivers, from E and Zhen eastward to the sea became the Qi and Zhao states; From Chen westward, south to the Nine Doubts Mountains, east along the Jiang, Huai, Gu, and Si Rivers, bordering Kuaiji, became the Liang, Chu, Huainan, and Changsha states: all bordering externally on the Hu and Yue barbarians. As for the inner lands north of the mountains eastward, all were the territories of feudal lords. The largest domains encompassed five or six commanderies, with dozens of connected cities. They established hundreds of officials and built palaces and observatories that rivaled the Son of Heaven. The Han alone controlled Sanhe, Dongjun, Yingchuan, and Nanyang commanderies, stretching from Jiangling westward to Shu and northward from Yunzhong to Longxi. Together with the capital region, this made fifteen commanderies in total. Many princesses and marquises also held fiefs within these territories. Why was this so? When the realm was first pacified, there were few close relatives of the same surname, so the emperor strengthened collateral branches of the family to maintain control over the four seas and support the Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 漢定百年之閒，親屬益疏，諸侯或驕奢，忕邪臣計謀為淫亂，大者叛逆，小者不軌于法，以危其命，殞身亡國。

translations.literal: Han settled hundred years interval, close relatives increasingly distant, feudal lords or arrogant extravagant, listened evil ministers planned made licentious chaos, great rebelled inverse, small not followed law, to endanger their lives, perished body lost state.
translations.idiomatic: After a century of Han rule, family ties grew distant. Some feudal lords became arrogant and extravagant, swayed by slandering ministers who schemed for chaos. The greater lords rebelled, the lesser ones broke the law, endangering their lives and leading to their destruction and the loss of their states.

sentences.zh: 天子觀於上古，然後加惠，使諸侯得推恩分子弟國邑，故齊分為七，趙分為六，梁分為五，淮南分三，及天子支庶子為王，王子支庶為侯，百有餘焉。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven observed upper ancient, then added favor, made feudal lords obtain push kindness divide sons younger brothers state yi, therefore Qi divided seven, Zhao divided six, Liang divided five, Huai Nan divided three, and Son of Heaven branch descendants sons as wang, wang sons branch descendants as hou, hundred plus.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven, observing ancient precedents, then showed favor by allowing feudal lords to extend grace to their younger sons and divide their territories among them. Thus Qi was divided into seven parts, Zhao into six, Liang into five, and Huainan into three. Even the Son of Heaven's collateral sons became kings, and kings' collateral sons became marquises - more than a hundred in total.

sentences.zh: 吳楚時，前后諸侯或以適削地，是以燕、代無北邊郡，吳、淮南、長沙無南邊郡，齊、趙、梁、楚支郡名山陂海咸納於漢。

translations.literal: Wu Chu time, before after feudal lords or because proper diminished lands, therefore Yan, Dai no north border jun, Wu, Huai Nan, Changsha no south border jun, Qi, Zhao, Liang, Chu branch jun famous mountains marshes seas all entered Han.
translations.idiomatic: During the Wu and Chu rebellions, successive feudal lords lost territories due to their transgressions. Thus Yan and Dai had no northern border commanderies, while Wu, Huainan, and Changsha had no southern border commanderies. The branch commanderies of Qi, Zhao, Liang, and Chu - with their famous mountains, dikes, and coastal regions - all reverted to Han control.

sentences.zh: 諸侯稍微，大國不過十餘城，小侯不過數十里，上足以奉貢職，下足以供養祭祀，以蕃輔京師。

translations.literal: Feudal lords slightly diminished, great states not over ten plus cities, small hou not over several ten li, above sufficient serve tribute duty, below sufficient supply nourish sacrifices, to multiply assist capital.
translations.idiomatic: The power of the feudal lords was gradually diminished. The greatest states controlled no more than ten or so cities, while the smallest marquises held no more than several dozen li of territory. This was enough to fulfill their tribute obligations above and maintain sacrificial rites below, while guarding and supporting the capital.

sentences.zh: 而漢郡八九十，形錯諸侯閒，犬牙相臨，秉其阸塞地利，彊本干，弱枝葉之勢，尊卑明而萬事各得其所矣。

translations.literal: And Han jun eighty ninety, form interlocked feudal lords interval, dog teeth mutually adjacent, grasped their narrow closed land profit, strong root trunk, weak branch leaf situation, honored lowly clear and ten thousand affairs each obtained their place.
translations.idiomatic: The Han controlled eighty to ninety commanderies, interspersed among the feudal territories like interlocking dog teeth. They controlled the strategic passes and terrain advantages, strengthening the trunk while weakening the branches and leaves. Thus the hierarchy was clear and everything fell into its proper place.

translations.literal: After a century of Han rule, family ties grew distant. Some feudal lords became arrogant and extravagant, swayed by slandering ministers who schemed for chaos. The greater lords rebelled, the lesser ones broke the law, endangering their lives and leading to their destruction and the loss of their states. The Son of Heaven, observing ancient precedents, then showed favor by allowing feudal lords to extend grace to their younger sons and divide their territories among them. Thus Qi was divided into seven parts, Zhao into six, Liang into five, and Huainan into three. Even the Son of Heaven's collateral sons became kings, and kings' collateral sons became marquises - more than a hundred in total. During the Wu and Chu rebellions, successive feudal lords lost territories due to their transgressions. Thus Yan and Dai had no northern border commanderies, while Wu, Huainan, and Changsha had no southern border commanderies. The branch commanderies of Qi, Zhao, Liang, and Chu - with their famous mountains, dikes, and coastal regions - all reverted to Han control. The power of the feudal lords was gradually diminished. The greatest states controlled no more than ten or so cities, while the smallest marquises held no more than several dozen li of territory. This was enough to fulfill their tribute obligations above and maintain sacrificial rites below, while guarding and supporting the capital. The Han controlled eighty to ninety commanderies, interspersed among the feudal territories like interlocking dog teeth. They controlled the strategic passes and terrain advantages, strengthening the trunk while weakening the branches and leaves. Thus the hierarchy was clear and everything fell into its proper place.

sentences.zh: 臣遷謹記高祖以來至太初諸侯，譜其下益損之時，令時世得覽。

translations.literal: Subject Qian respectfully recorded Gaozu since to Tai Chu feudal lords, tabulated their below increase diminish time, make time world obtain view.
translations.idiomatic: I, Qian, respectfully record the feudal lords from Gaozu's time until the Tai Chu era, charting the times when their territories increased or decreased, so that the present age may view them.

sentences.zh: 形勢雖彊，要之以仁義為本。

translations.literal: Form situation though strong, essential with benevolence righteousness as foundation.
translations.idiomatic: Though the strategic position was strong, benevolence and righteousness were essential as its foundation.

translations.literal: I, Qian, respectfully record the feudal lords from Gaozu's time until the Tai Chu era, charting the times when their territories increased or decreased, so that the present age may view them. Though the strategic position was strong, benevolence and righteousness were essential as its foundation.

cells.content: 十一月，初王韓信元年。都馬邑。
cells.literal: Eleventh month, initially king Han Xin first year. Capital at Maiyi
Initially king Xin first year. Former Chancellor.

cells.content: 十月乙丑，初王英布元年。
cells.literal: Tenth month bingchou, initially king Ying Bu first year.
Initially king Zhang Er first year. Died.

cells.content: 齊王信徙為楚王元年。反，廢。
cells.literal: Qi king Xin transferred to Chu king first year. Rebelled, deposed.

cells.content: 後九月壬子，初王盧綰元年。
cells.literal: Nine months later renyin, initially king Lu Wan first year.
King Ao first year. Ao, Er's son.
Initially king Peng Yue first year
Fourth year. Surrendered to Xiongnu, state abolished as commandery.

cells.content: 二月乙未，初王文王吳芮元年。薨。
cells.literal: Second month bingwei, initially king Wen Wang Wu Rui first year. Died.

cells.content: 正月丙午，初王交元年。交，高祖弟。
cells.literal: First month bingwu, initially king Jiao first year. Jiao, Gaozu's younger brother.

cells.content: 正月甲子，初王悼惠王肥元年。肥，高祖子。
cells.literal: First month jiashu, initially king Daohui Wang Fei first year. Fei, Gaozu's son.

cells.content: 正月丙午，初王劉賈元年。
cells.literal: First month bingwu, initially king Liu Jia first year.

cells.content: 初王隱王如意元年。如意，高祖子。
cells.literal: Initially king Yin Wang Ruyi first year. Ruyi, Gaozu's son.
Seventh year. Came to court. Rebelled, executed.
Sixth year. Came to court. Rebelled, executed.
Again established Dai, capital at Zhongdu.

cells.content: 六。為英布所殺，國除為郡。
cells.literal: Sixth year. Killed by Ying Bu, state abolished as commandery.

cells.content: 十二月庚午，厲王長元年。長，高祖子。
cells.literal: Twelfth month gengwu, Li Wang Chang first year. Chang, Gaozu's son.

cells.content: 二月丙午，初王恢元年。恢，高祖子。
cells.literal: Second month bingwu, initially king Hui first year. Hui, Gaozu's son.

cells.content: 三月丙寅，初王友元年。友，高祖子。
cells.literal: Third month bingyin, initially king You first year. You, Gaozu's son.
First month bingzi initially king first year.

cells.content: 更為吳國。十月辛丑，初王濞元年。濞，高祖兄仲子，故沛侯。
cells.literal: Changed to Wu state. Tenth month xinchou, initially king Pi first year. Pi, Gaozu's elder brother Zhong's son, former Pei marquess.

cells.content: 二月甲午，初王靈王建元年。建，高祖子。
cells.literal: Second month jiashu, initially king Ling Wang Jian first year. Jian, Gaozu's son.

cells.content: 淮陽王徙於趙，名友，元年。是為幽王。
cells.literal: Huaiyang king transferred to Zhao, named You, first year. This is King You.

cells.content: 四月初王張偃元年。偃，高后外孫，故趙王敖子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, initially wang Zhang Yan first year. Yan, Empress Gao outer grandson, former Zhao wang son.

cells.content: 四月辛卯，哀王不疑元年。薨。
cells.literal: Fourth month Xin Mao, Ai Wang Bu Yi first year. Died.

cells.content: 四月辛卯，呂王台元年。薨。
cells.literal: Fourth month Xin Mao, Lü Wang Tai first year. Died.

cells.content: 四月辛卯，初王懷王強元年。強，惠帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month Xin Mao, initially wang Huai Wang Qiang first year. Qiang, Hui Di son.

cells.content: 七月癸巳，初王義元年。哀王弟。義，孝惠子，故襄城侯，立為帝。
cells.literal: Seventh month Gui Si, initially wang Yi first year. Ai Wang younger brother. Yi, Xiao Hui son, former Xiang Cheng hou, established as emperor.

cells.content: 十一月癸亥，王呂嘉元年。嘉，肅王子。
cells.literal: Eleventh month Gui Hai, wang Lü Jia first year. Jia, Shu Wang son.

cells.content: 五月丙辰，初王朝元年。朝，惠帝子，故軹侯。
cells.literal: Fifth month, Bingchen day, Xiaowang's first year. Xiao, son of Emperor Hui, former Marquis of Zhi.

cells.content: 嘉廢。七月丙辰，呂產元年。產，肅王弟，故洨侯。
cells.literal: Jia deposed. Seventh month, Bingchen day, Lü Chan's first year. Chan, younger brother of King Su, former Marquis of Tao.

cells.content: 初王武元年。武，孝惠帝子，故壺關侯。
cells.literal: Initially king Wu first year. Wu, Xiaohui Emperor's son, former Huguan marquess.
King Ze first year. Former Yingling marquess.
. Transferred to Zhao, suicide. King Lü Chan first year.

cells.content: 呂產徙王梁。二月丁巳，王太元年。惠帝子。
cells.literal: Lü Chan transferred to Liang king. Second month dingwei, King Tai first year. Hui Emperor's son.

cells.content: 十月辛丑，初王呂通元年。肅王子，故東平侯。九月誅，國除。
cells.literal: Tenth month xinchou, initially king Lü Tong first year. Su Wang's son, former Dongping marquess. Ninth month executed, state abolished.

cells.content: 初王呂祿元年。呂后兄子，胡陵侯。誅，國除。
cells.literal: Initially king Lü Lu first year. Empress Lü's elder brother's son, Huling marquess. Executed, state abolished.
Fifth year. Not son, executed, state abolished as commandery.
Second year. Criminal, executed, became commandery.
Third year. Wu executed, state abolished.

cells.content: 十月庚戌，琅邪王澤徙燕元年。是為敬王。
cells.literal: Tenth month gengxu, Langye king Ze transferred to Yan first year. This is King Jing.

cells.content: 十月庚戌，趙王遂元年。幽王子。
cells.literal: Tenth month gengxu, Zhao king Sui first year. You Wang's son.
Divided into Hejian, capital at Lecheng.
Initially established Taiyuan, capital at Jinyang.

cells.content: 二月乙卯景王章元年。章，悼惠王子，故朱虛侯。
cells.literal: Second month yimao, Jing Wang Zhang first year. Zhang, Daohui Wang's son, former Zhuxu marquess.

cells.content: 二月乙卯，王興居元年。興居，悼惠王子，故東牟侯。
cells.literal: Second month yimao, Wang Xingju first year. Xingju, Daohui Wang's son, former Dongmu marquess.

cells.content: 二月乙卯，初王文王辟強元年。辟強，趙幽王子。
cells.literal: Second month yimao, initially king Wen Wang Piqiang first year. Piqiang, Zhao You Wang's son.

cells.content: 二月乙卯，初王參元年。參，文帝子。
cells.literal: Second month yimao, initially king Shen first year. Shen, Wen Emperor's son.

cells.content: 二月乙卯，初王懷王勝元年。勝，文帝子。
cells.literal: Second month yimao, initially king Huai Wang Sheng first year. Sheng, Wen Emperor's son.

cells.content: 二月乙卯，初王武元年。武，文帝子。
cells.literal: Second month yimao, initially king Wu first year. Wu, Wen Emperor's son.
Third year. Changed to Dai king.
Dai king Wu transferred to Huaiyang third year.

cells.content: 三。太原王參更號為代王三年，實居太原，是為孝王。
cells.literal: Third year. Taiyuan king Shen changed title to Dai king third year, actually resided in Taiyuan, this is Xiao Wang.

cells.content: 二十三。王無道，遷蜀，死雍，為郡。
cells.literal: Twenty-three. King behaved without moral principles, relocated to Shu, died in Yong, made into commandery.
Eight. Relocated to Huainan. Made into commandery, attached to Qi.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Moved to Huainan. Became a commandery, subordinate to Qi.

cells.literal: Ten. Came to court. Died, no heir.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Came to court. Died without an heir.

cells.literal: Ten. Came to court. Relocated to Liang. Made into commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Came to court. Moved to Liang. Became a commandery.

cells.literal: King Xi of Chengyang relocated to Huainan first year
cells.idiomatic: First year of Chengyang King Xi's move to Huainan

cells.content: 十一。淮陽王武徙梁年，是為孝王。
cells.literal: Eleven. King Wu of Huaiyang relocated to Liang year, this is King Xiao.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Year that Huaiyang King Wu moved to Liang, becoming the Filial King.
Divided to become the Jinan state.

cells.literal: Divided into Zichuan, capital at Ju.
cells.idiomatic: Divided to become Zichuan, with capital at Ju.

cells.literal: Divided into Jiaoxi, capital at Wan.
cells.idiomatic: Divided to become Jiaoxi, with capital at Wan.

cells.literal: Divided into Jiaodong, capital at Jimo.
cells.idiomatic: Divided to become Jiaodong, with capital at Jimo.

cells.content: 哀王福元年。薨，無後，國除為郡。
cells.literal: King Ai Fu first year. Died, no heir, state abolished and made into commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Aiwang Fu's first year. Died without an heir, state abolished and became a commandery.

cells.content: 四月丙寅，王勃元年。淮南厲王子，故安陽侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Bingyin day, King Bo first year. Son of King Li of Huainan, former Marquis of Anyang.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, King Bo's first year. Son of Huainan King Li, formerly Marquis of Anyang.

cells.content: 四月丙寅，孝王將閭元年。齊悼惠王子，故陽虛侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Bingyin day, King Xiao Jianglü first year. Son of King Daohui of Qi, former Marquis of Yangxu.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, King Xiao Jianglü's first year. Son of Qi King Daohui, formerly Marquis of Yangxu.

cells.content: 淮南王喜徙城陽十三年。
cells.literal: King Xi of Huainan relocated to Chengyang thirteenth year.
cells.idiomatic: Huainan King Xi's move to Chengyang thirteenth year.

cells.content: 四月丙寅，初王志元年。齊悼惠王子，故安都侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Bingyin day, initial king Zhi first year. Son of King Daohui of Qi, former Marquis of Andu.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, King Chu Zhi's first year. Son of Qi King Daohui, formerly Marquis of Andu.

cells.content: 四月丙寅，初王辟光元年。齊悼惠王子，故扐侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Bingyin day, initial king Piguang first year. Son of King Daohui of Qi, former Marquis of Xun.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, King Chu Biguang's first year. Son of Qi King Daohui, formerly Marquis of Xun.

cells.content: 四月丙寅，初王賢元年。齊悼惠王子，故武城侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Bingyin day, initial king Xian first year. Son of King Daohui of Qi, former Marquis of Wucheng.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, King Chu Xian's first year. Son of Qi King Daohui, formerly Marquis of Wucheng.

cells.content: 四月丙寅，初王卬元年。齊悼惠王子，故平昌侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Bingyin day, initial king Ang first year. Son of King Daohui of Qi, former Marquis of Pingchang.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, King Chu Ang's first year. Son of Qi King Daohui, formerly Marquis of Pingchang.

cells.content: 四月丙寅，初王雄渠元年。齊悼惠王子，故白石侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Bingyin day, initial king Xiongqu first year. Son of King Daohui of Qi, former Marquis of Baishi.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, King Chu Xiongqu's first year. Son of Qi King Daohui, formerly Marquis of Baishi.

cells.content: 四月丙寅，王安元年。淮南厲王子，故阜陵侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Bingyin day, King An first year. Son of King Li of Huainan, former Marquis of Fuling.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, King An's first year. Son of Huainan King Li, formerly Marquis of Fuling.

cells.content: 四月丙寅，王賜元年。淮南厲王子，故陽周侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Bingyin day, King Ci first year. Son of King Li of Huainan, former Marquis of Yangzhou.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, King Ci's first year. Son of Huainan King Li, formerly Marquis of Yangzhou.

cells.content: 二十一。來朝。薨，無後，國除。
cells.literal: Twenty-one. Came to court. Died, no heir, state abolished.
Guangchuan initially established, capital at Xindu.
Linjiang initially established, capital at Jiangling.
Divided Chu and reestablished Lu state.

cells.content: 三月甲寅，初王獻王德元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, Jiaoyin day, initial king Xian Wang De first year. Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 三月甲寅，王彭祖元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, Jiaoyin day, King Pengzu first year. Son of Emperor Jing.
Zhongshan initially established, capital at Lunu.

cells.content: 三月甲寅，初王閼于元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, Jiaoyin day, initial king Yanyu first year. Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 三月甲寅，初王非元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, Jiaoyin day, initial king Fei first year. Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 三月甲寅，初王餘元年，景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, Jiaoyin day, initial king Yu first year, son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 三月甲寅，定王發元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, Jiaoyin day, King Ding Fa first year. Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 六月乙亥淮陽王徙魯元年。是為恭王。
cells.literal: Sixth month, Yihai day, King of Huaiyang relocated to Lu first year. This is King Gong.
Eleven. Rebelled, executed. Made into commandery.

cells.content: 十一。反，誅。濟北王志徙菑川十一年。是為懿王。
cells.literal: Eleven. Rebelled, executed. King Zhi of Jibei relocated to Zichuan eleventh year. This is King Yi.

cells.content: 十一。反，誅。六月乙亥，于王端元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Eleven. Rebelled, executed. Sixth month, Yihai day, King Yu Duan first year. Son of Emperor Jing.
Twenty-six. Rebelled, executed. Made into commandery.

cells.content: 六月乙亥，靖王勝元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Sixth month, Yihai day, King Jing Sheng first year. Son of Emperor Jing.
Relocated to Lu. Made into commandery.
Four. Fourth month, Jisi day, established crown prince

cells.content: 文王禮元年。元王子，故平陸侯。
cells.literal: King Wen Li first year. Son of King Yuan, former Marquis of Pinglu.

cells.content: 十二。徙濟北。廬江王賜徙衡山元年。
cells.literal: Twelve. Relocated to Jibei. King Ci of Lujiang relocated to Hengshan first year.

cells.content: 衡山王勃徙濟北十二年。是為貞王。
cells.literal: King Bo of Hengshan relocated to Jibei twelfth year. This is King Zhen.

cells.content: 四月己巳，初王元年。是為孝武帝。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Jisi day, initial king first year. This is Emperor Xiaowu.

cells.content: 初置江都。六月乙亥，汝南王非為江都王元年。是為易王。
cells.literal: Jiangdu initially established. Sixth month, Yihai day, King Fei of Runan became King of Jiangdu first year. This is King Yi.
Twelve. Relocated to Hengshan, state abolished and made into commandery.
Three. Died, no heir, state abolished and made into commandery.

cells.content: 廣川王彭祖徙趙四年。是為敬肅王。
cells.literal: King Pengzu of Guangchuan relocated to Zhao fourth year. This is King Jing Su.
Four. Relocated to Zhao, state abolished and made into Xindu commandery.
Seven. Eleventh month, Yichou day, crown prince deposed
Four. Fourth month, Dingsi day, became crown prince.

cells.content: 十一月乙丑，初王閔王榮元年。景帝太子，廢。
cells.literal: Eleventh month, Yichou day, initial king Min Wang Rong first year. Crown prince of Emperor Jing, deposed.

cells.content: 四月乙巳，初王康王寄元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Yisi day, initial king Kang Wang Ji first year. Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 四月乙巳，惠王越元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Yisi day, King Hui Yue first year. Son of Emperor Jing.
Qinghe initially established, capital at Qingyang.

cells.content: 三月丁巳，哀王乘元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, Dingsi day, King Ai Cheng first year. Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 四。坐侵廟壖垣為宮，自殺。國除為南郡。
cells.literal: Four. Convicted of encroaching on temple grounds to build palace, committed suicide. State abolished and made into Nangong commandery.

cells.content: 四月丁巳，初王憲王舜元年。孝景子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Dingsi day, initial king Xian Wang Shun first year. Son of Emperor Jing.

cells.content: 五月丙戌，初王明元年。梁孝王子。
cells.literal: Fifth month, Bingxu day, initial king Ming first year. Son of King Xiao of Liang.

cells.content: 五月丙戌，初王彭離元年。梁孝王子。
cells.literal: Fifth month, Bingxu day, initial king Pengli first year. Son of King Xiao of Liang.

cells.content: 五月丙戌，初王定元年。梁孝王子。
cells.literal: Fifth month, Bingxu day, initial king Ding first year. Son of King Xiao of Liang.

cells.content: 五月丙戌，初王不識元年。梁孝王子。
cells.literal: Fifth month, Bingxu day, initial king Bushi first year. Son of King Xiao of Liang.
King Gong Mai first year. Son of King Xiao.
Two. Died, no heir, state abolished.
Seven. Ming killed the imperial tutor. Deposed and relocated to Fangling.
Twelve. Died, no heir, state abolished and made into commandery.
Nine. Died, no heir, state abolished and made into commandery.

cells.content: 二十四。坐禽獸行自殺。國除為郡。
cells.literal: Twenty-four. Convicted of bestial behavior, committed suicide. State abolished and made into commandery.
Five. Died, no heir, state abolished and made into commandery.

cells.content: 四十一。安有罪，削國二縣。
cells.literal: Forty-one. An committed crime, state reduced by two counties.
Thirty-two. Rebelled, committed suicide, state abolished.

cells.content: 七。反，自殺，國除為廣陵郡。
cells.literal: Seven. Rebelled, committed suicide, state abolished and made into Guangling commandery.

cells.content: 置六安國，以故陳為都。七月丙子。初王恭王慶元年。膠東王子。
cells.literal: Liu'an state established, former Chen as capital. Seventh month, Bingzi day. Initial king Gong Wang Qing first year. Son of King of Jiaodong.

cells.content: 四月乙巳，初王懷王閎元年。武帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Yisi day, initial king Huai Wang Hong first year. Son of Emperor Wu.

cells.content: 四月乙巳，初王胥元年。武帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Yisi day, initial king Xu first year. Son of Emperor Wu.

cells.content: 四月乙巳，初王剌王旦元年。武帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, Yisi day, initial king La Wang Dan first year. Son of Emperor Wu.

cells.content: 二十九。剽攻殺人，遷上庸，國為大河郡。
cells.literal: Twenty-nine. Robbed and killed people, relocated to Shangyong, state made into Dahe commandery.
Sishui initially established, capital at Tan.
Nineteen. Relocated to Qinghe. Made into Taiyuan commandery.

cells.content: 思王商元年。商，常山憲王子。
cells.literal: King Si Shang first year. Shang, son of King Xian of Changshan.

cells.content: 二十。代王義徙清河年。是為剛王。
cells.literal: Twenty. King Yi of Dai relocated to Qinghe year. This is King Gang.

cells.content: 更為真定國。頃王平元年。常山憲王子。
cells.literal: Changed to Zhending state. King Qing Ping first year. Son of King Xian of Changshan.
King Ai Chang first year. Died same year.
Eight. Died, no heir, state abolished and made into commandery.
Forty-seven. Died, no heir, state abolished.

cells.content: 哀王安世元年。即戴王賀元年。安世子。
cells.literal: King Ai Anshi first year. That is King Dai He first year. Son of Anshi.
